title: Retired Carr: Couldn't 'just take' Saints' money
content: To deal with a significant shoulder injury, surgery was considered an option, as was trying to play through it, but former Saints quarterback Derek Carr says he ultimately didn't feel right with either possibility.

title: Source: Ravens give WR Bateman $36.75M deal
content: The Ravens have signed wide receiver Rashod Bateman to a three-year, $36.75 million contract extension that includes $20 million guaranteed, a source told ESPN.

title: Draisaitl's OT goal caps Oilers' rally in Game 1 win
content: Leon Draisaitl scored on a power play in overtime after the Oilers erased a multigoal deficit to beat the defending champion Panthers 4-3 in Game 1 of their Stanley Cup Final rematch.

title: Atwood pounces on IBB try to lift Texas at WCWS
content: Reese Atwood hit a go-ahead, two-run single for Texas when Texas Tech ace NiJaree Canady was trying to walk her, and the Longhorns beat the Red Raiders 2-1 in Game 1 of the Women's College World Series finals Wednesday night.

title: Michigan offers 2027 safety Charles Woodson Jr.
content: Michigan has extended an offer to class of 2027 safety Charles Woodson Jr., opening its recruitment of the son of Pro Football Hall of Famer and Wolverines 1997 Heisman Trophy winner Charles Woodson.

title: Red Sox win on shortest walk-off HR on record
content: Ceddanne Rafaela curled a 308-foot home run around the Pesky Pole in the bottom of the ninth inning on Wednesday, and the Red Sox rallied after trailing four different times to beat the Angels 11-9.

title: Twins' Lopez out 8-12 weeks with shoulder injury
content: Twins right-hander Pablo Lopez is expected to miss 8-12 weeks with a Grade 2 strain in his right shoulder.

title: Manfred 'paid attention' to Trump support of Rose
content: Rob Manfred took President Donald Trump's support of Pete Rose into account when the MLB commissioner decided that permanent bans by the sport ended with death.

content: It's that time again: with the UEFA Champions League final behind us and the 2024-25 season officially over, it's time to rank the top 100 players in the world of men's soccer right now. Welcome to the FC 100.

content: Though still reeling from the Eaton fire, a group of L.A. area runners are determined to build a worthwhile future.

title: What it's like in the Rockies' clubhouse as they barrel toward the wrong kind of history
content: Colorado has made headlines for all the wrong reasons so far, but the Rockies aren't giving up just yet.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers or Tigers No. 1 this week?
content: While baseball's powerhouses battle for the top spot, two contenders continue their fall down our list.

title: Is Novak Djokovic a real contender for the French Open title?
content: He defeated No. 3 Zverev in the quarterfinals -- but can Djokovic continue this level? In his way stands Sinner, and likely Alcaraz too.

content: Let's stack every WNBA team's core by the youth of its roster, leading off with the Fever and Caitlin Clark.

title: NHRC notice to Telangana over death of man due to police torture
content: The 35-year-old autorickshaw driver died after being subjected to physical torture by police at Rajendranagar station in Hyderabad

title: Collectors exhort people to adopt lifestyle sans plastic
content: Plantation drives were held to mark the World Environment Day celebrations with the District Collectors planting saplings and calling for people to plant more trees and ensure there protection

title: ECI upgrades mechanism for Index Cards on electoral data, replaces manual entry
content: By leveraging automation and data integration, the new system ensures faster reporting, the ECI said

title: Saffron flag-holding Bharath Matha motif at an official function emerges as a sore point between government and Raj Bhavan
content: The picture of Bharat Math astride a lion at Raj Bhavan’s central hall, where the World Environment Day inauguration was scheduled to be held, emerged as a sore point between the Left Democratic Front (LDF) government and the Governor’s office, prompting Agriculture Minister P. Prasad to skip the event.

title: Govt. slammed for last-minute scrapping of Friday’s Bakrid holiday
content: IUML State general secretary P.M.A. Salam has demanded that the government declare a separate holiday on Saturday rather than scrapping the previously announced holiday on Friday.

title: Bihar sanctions compensation, pension for family of Dalit minor rape victim
content: 11-year-old girl succumbed to injuries after being denied timely treatment; political outrage intensifies

title: The Hindu wins environment journalism prize
content: A collection of over 30 environmental stories authored by K.S. Sudhi and published in The Hindu in 2024 won the award.

title: Civil judicial staff launch protest against ban on new appointments
content: They allege that the smooth functioning of various courts has been hit owing to negligence of the State government

title: At least 63 evacuated from landslide-hit north Sikkim by helicopters, 64 others await rescue
content: The operation to rescue 64 other tourists was called off due to inclement weather and challenging terrains during the day, officials said

title: Bengaluru stampede: Police register FIR against RCB, KSCA and event management company DNA
content: The complaint said necessary security had been arranged at the Vidhana Soudha for the felicitation programme and getting the cricket team from HAL airport to Taj West End hotel to Vidhana Soudha premises

title: India, US Push To Close Interim Tariff Deal As Trump's Deadline Nears
content: Indian and US are holding high-level talks this week, aiming to finalise tariff cuts in sectors such as farm and automobiles as part of an interim deal, two government sources said, with an announcement likely later this month.

title: Case Filed Against RCB, Karnataka Cricket Body Over Bengaluru Stampede Deaths
content: The Bengaluru Police have filed a case on their own against RCB, the state cricket body, and DNA Entertainment over the stampede on Wednesday that killed 11 and left dozens injured.

title: Adani Ports Marks World Environment Day With Major Sustainability Milestone
content: In a significant stride toward environmental responsibility, Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd (APSEZ) on Thursday marked World Environment Day with a major sustainability achievement.

title: India Helping Auto Industry Meet Chinese Officials On Rare Earth Export Ban: Sources
content: The Prime Minister's Office and the Indian embassy in China are helping Indian auto companies to hold a meeting with the Chinese commerce ministry in Beijing amid the neighbouring country's ban on export of rare earth magnets, sources said.

title: 581 Paramilitary Force Companies, Jammers, Drones To Secure Amarnath Yatra
content: The Amarnath Yatra, a 38-day pilgrimage to the holy cave shrine in Jammu and Kashmir, has been secured with a massive deployment of 581 Central Armed Police Forces (CAPF) companies, jammers, and drones.

title: "Don't Like Girls Who...": Another Unfiltered Comment From Kailash Vijayvargiya
content: Senior BJP leader and Madhya Pradesh Cabinet Minister Kailash Vijayvargiya has stirred controversy once again with his remarks about women's clothing.

title: Opinion: Opinion | There's A Country India Must Take More Seriously: Kazakhstan
content: Though India is a giant with a billion population and Kazakhstan is a nascent republic, only 34 years old with a population of about 20 million, there are many convergences in their foreign policies and positions on global issues.

title: Despite Pak Pressure, Malaysia Warmly Welcomed Indian Delegation: BJP MP Hemang Joshi To NDTV
content: In a major diplomatic success for India, Malaysia extended a warm and official welcome to an Indian parliamentary delegation despite behind-the-scenes pressure from Pakistan, said BJP MP Dr Hemang Joshi in an exclusive conversation with NDTV.

title: Delhi Discoms Offer New ACs, Fans To Consumers At Heavy Discount
content: People in the national capital can avail of a scheme announced by BSES discoms and replace their old air conditioners and ceiling fans during the ongoing summer with new appliances at discounts of 69-89 per cent.

title: Apple Gives Tata India iPhone Repair Business As Partnership Expands: Report
content: Apple has brought in Tata Group to handle repairs for iPhones and MacBook devices in its fast-growing Indian market, signalling the Indian conglomerate's deepening role in the U.S. tech giant's supply chain, two people familiar with the matter said.

title: Endgame In Battle Against Maoists? 15 Key Figures Still Lurk In Shadows
content: The death of Basavaraju, the elusive supremo of the CPI (Maoist), in a high-stakes anti-Naxal operation deep in the jungles of Abujhmad on May 21, marked what authorities describe as a decisive turning point in India's war against Left-Wing Extremism

title: Egypt, Greece Agree To Protect Status Of Mount Sinai Monastery, After Court Ruling
content: Greece and Egypt have agreed to safeguard the status of one of the world's oldest sites of Christian worship, foreign ministers of both countries said late on Wednesday, after an Egyptian court ruling last week cast uncertainty over its future.

title: Fire Breaks Out At Mumbai's Churchgate Station, None Injured
content: A fire broke out at a shop inside the busy Churchgate railway station in south Mumbai on Thursday evening, triggering panic among commuters during the peak hours.

title: Russia Casualties Near 1 Million Mark In Ukraine War: Report
content: Over 950,000 Russian soldiers have been killed since the full-scale invasion of Ukraine began in 2022, according to a new report by the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS).

title: India Plans Rare Earth Magnet Incentives As Supply Threat Mounts: Report
content: India is holding talks with companies to establish long-term stockpiles of rare earth magnets by offering fiscal incentives for domestic production, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Bengaluru Stampede Live Updates: Police Case Filed Against RCB, Karnataka Cricket Body Over Stampede Deaths
content: Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede LIVE Updates: At least 11 people died and 50 were injured outside the Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru as thousands of fans gathered to greet the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) after winning the IPL.

title: NDTV Ground Report: Key Facts About World's Tallest Rail Bridge In India
content: The world will see an engineering marvel in India on Friday when Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurates the world's tallest railway bridge over the River Chenab in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: In Pics: Key Facts About World's Tallest Railway Bridge In J&K
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the world's tallest railway bridge, an engineering marvel, over the River Chenab in Jammu and Kashmir on Friday.

title: Video: CCTV Captures Indore Couple Before They Went Missing In Meghalaya
content: As the mystery surrounding the disappearance of an Indore couple in Meghalaya deepens, footage from a CCTV at a hotel where they were staying has emerged. The blurry video shows Raja Raghuvanshi and his newly-wedded wife Sonam

title: "Entire State Was Watching. We Are Very Sorry": DK Shivakumar On Stampede Deaths
content: Underlining that he can't express the pain that "we are suffering" over the deaths in a crowd crush outside a Bengaluru stadium as tens of thousands turned up to cheer RCB's win the IPL), said Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar.

content: Cole Palmer has been handed Mykhailo Mudryk's No. 10 shirt at Chelsea, the club confirmed on Thursday.

title: Willian: Chelsea's Estêvão has potential of Yamal
content: Former Chelsea winger Willian believes new signing Estêvão could be as good as Lamine Yamal and can help the club win titles again for years to come.

title: Ronaldo fires Portugal past Germany to NL final
content: Cristiano Ronaldo scored the winner as Portugal fought back to beat Germany 2-1 on Wednesday and reach the Nations League final.

title: Report: Brailsford to scale back Man United role
content: Manchester United's football operations are undergoing yet more change with Dave Brailsford scaling back his role, a source told The Associated Press.

title: USMNT's Steffen (knee) set to miss Gold Cup
content: Zack Steffen injured a knee and became the second goalkeeper dropped from the United States' training camp ahead of the Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Ancelotti: Brazil need Vini to replicate Madrid form
content: Brazil must help striker Vinicius Jr rediscover the form he has displayed at Real Madrid, new national team coach Carlo Ancelotti said on Wednesday.

title: Delap joins Chelsea from Ipswich in $40.6m deal
content: Chelsea have bolstered their forward line with the signing of 22-year-old striker Liam Delap from Ipswich Town.

title: 'I have a lot to prove': Broncos' Bo Nix striving to up his game after successful rookie season
content: Nix led all rookies in touchdown passes and got the Broncos to the playoffs, but he knows the NFL will be ready for him in Year 2.

title: 'I'm not naïve': Hugh Freeze knows Auburn needs to start winning soon
content: The Tigers have scored recruiting and portal wins of late -- now they have to deliver where it matters most.

title: U.S. visa uncertainties put college rosters in a bind
content: College coaches and international athletes are stuck in an unnerving limbo, saying they're unsure how to plan for recent changes in U.S. student visa policy that could potentially wreak havoc on their rosters this year.

title: Pacers, Thunder is latest NBA Finals matchup that includes long championship drought
content: This year is the second NBA Finals in which both participants are on title droughts that exceed 40 years.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Ten Hag to give Antony a Man United escape route at Leverkusen
content: New Bayer Leverkusen coach Erik ten Hag is ready to make a move for Manchester United forward Antony. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Odds, post positions for the Belmont Stakes
content: Preakness winner Journalism and Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty have the best odds in the eight-horse field for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

content: They say the move will impact the wildlife within the reserve and sever elephant pathways. They demand that the camp and a newly built mahout village to be shifted to the periphery of the core zone

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Samayapuram Mariamman Temple shines in  colourful glow
content: HR&CE Minister P.K. Sekarbabu on June 4 inaugurated the decorative illumination system installed at the Samayapuram temple at a cost of ₹2 crore

title: Kharge, Rahul discuss Manipur situation with Congress leaders from state
content: The Congress has been urging Prime Minister Narendra Modi to visit the state of Manipur and heal the wounds of people who have suffered due to the violence

title: Tiruchi Corporation deploys special sanitation teams in all wards to overcome staff shortage
content: Officials say on any given day, around 10% of the workers are absent, which poses challenges in maintaining cleanliness in the city and hence the civic body formed teams

title: Hospital renovation row escalates as Veena targets protesters
content: To facilitate restoration work at Pathanamthitta Taluk General Hospital, some facilities are to be  temporarily relocated to Government Medical College Hospital at Konni

title: Elections via ballot papers will bring back BSP’s ‘good days’: Mayawati
content: Mayawati cautioned her party workers against "self-serving and opportunistic" organisations and parties that, she claimed, have no real connection with B.R. Ambedkar, BSP founder Kanshi Ram, or the broader Bahujan movement

title: Supplyco procures 1.05 lakh tonnes of paddy from Alappuzha
content: The agency purchases paddy at ₹28.2 a kg, which includes the minimum support price of ₹23 provided by the Union government and State government’s ₹5.20 incentive bonus

title: Thackeray cousins should talk to each other: Amit Thackeray on possibility of alliance
content: Cousins Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray have sparked speculation about a possible reconciliation with statements indicating they could ignore “trivial issues” and join hands nearly after two decades

title: Government must take resolute diplomatic actions to de-hyphenate India, Pakistan on global stage: Congress
content: Congress’ remarks came after the development that Pakistan will chair the Taliban Sanctions Committee of the U.N. Security Council for 2025 and will be vice-chair of the Counter-Terrorism Committee of the U.N. body

title: Does Rahul realise his statements are used by Pakistan against India: Shrikant Shinde
content: West African nations were not aware of the gravity of the problems between India and Pakistan - says Shrikant Shinde

title: School non-teaching staff take out rally near Kolkata demanding reinstatement
content: The agitators also claimed they are yet to receive the temporary monthly allowance previously announced by Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee.

title: RCB announces ₹10 lakh for families of Bengaluru stampede victims
content: The team’s management has announced the creation of RCB Cares to support the injured persons in the incident

title: 'Narender surrendered to Adani, China': Congress ups ante with fresh jibe at PM
content: Many of "Mr A's" international deals were struck soon after Narendra Modi's official visits to certain countries or after heads of government visited India, Congress leader Ajoy Kumar claimed

title: Bengaluru IPL stampede: Congress MLC admits lapses, says government was under pressure to felicitate RCB team
content: Congress MLC says there was no problem at the Vidhana Soudha where a State-organised felicitation programme was held, but turnout at the Chinnaswamy stadium was higher than expected

title: Tamil Nadu notifies Greater Flamingo Sanctuary at Dhanushkodi
content: The move aims to preserve a critical stopover point along the Central Asian Flyway for thousands of migratory wetland birds

title: Army unveils oxygen plant for high-altitude emergencies in Arunachal’s Tawang
content: The plant has been engineered for rapid deployment and optimal efficiency under extreme climatic conditions

title: Need politics that's not about glitz of events but connected with reality of everyday life: Rahul Gandhi
content: The Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha asserted that the country needs an economy that works for every Indian, not just for a select few capitalists

title: Delhi High Court quashes FIR against air traveller accused of staring at woman in flight
content: The High Court quashed the FIR given the settlement reached between the accused and the complainant woman.

title: Bengaluru stampede: A sea of cheers drowned out by wailing sirens
content: For fans of RCB in Bengaluru, an 18-year wait to celebrate the sweet triumph of their favourite team turned into a bitter tragedy as a crowd surge led to a stampede on June 4, 2025. This is The Hindu’s complete coverage of the sequence of events that led to the mishap and its aftermath.

title: Dassault Aviation partners with Tata Advanced Systems for Rafale fighter fuselage production in India
content: Describing it as a significant step forward in strengthening the country’s aerospace manufacturing capabilities and supporting global supply chains, Dassault Aviation said the facility represented a vital investment in India’s aerospace infrastructure

title: Sudarshan Venu to take over as chairman of TVS Motor
content: TVS Motor said its current chairman Sir Ralf Speth, has informed its board that he will not be seeking re-appointment as a company director

title: Bengaluru lost its image, BJP plays politics over stampede, says D.K. Shivakumar
content: “We are deeply hurt. The victims are our own family. The image of Karnataka, the image of Bengaluru...Yes we take responsibility“

title: Couldn’t sign letter for Parliament’s special session as I was on tour representing country: Supriya Sule
content: In a letter to PM Modi, 16 Opposition parties have demanded that a special session of Parliament be convened; the monsoon session of Parliament will be held from July 21 to August 12

title: Calcutta High Court grants interim bail to social media influencer Sharmistha Panoli
content: The High Court, while granting interim bail to Ms. Panoli, said “at this point there is no need of custodial interrogation”

title: Need to develop different approach for crowd management: Tharoor on Bengaluru stampede
content: State Home Minister G. Parameshwara said Karnataka Govt will formulate a new Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for mega events, meetings and celebrations aimed at preventing any untoward incidents

title: PM Modi launches Aravalli Green Wall Project, expands 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam' campaign
content: PM Modi launched a special initiative to reforest the 700-km Aravalli mountain range that stretches from Delhi to Gujarat

title: Telangana student deported from US; Hyderabad consultancy firm’s MD admits to have sent 15 students using forged documents
content: A consultancy firm’s MD admitted to having sent 15 students abroad over the past five years using forged documents to secure admissions

title: On World Environment Day, PM Modi plants sindoor sapling at residence
content: PM Modi said during his recent visit to Kutch, a group of women who had ​shown remarkable courage during the 1971 war met and presented him with the saplings

title: Karnataka govt to formulate new SOP for mega events, celebrations
content: Home Minister G. Parameshwara said that the government will take strict measures identifying the lapses that led to the stampede near the stadium

title: Two dead, seven injured as SUV hits auto in A.P.’s Atmakur
content: Two of the injured persons were referred to Nellore GGH, while the rest five were admitted into Atmakur government hospital

title: Karnataka government accords ‘royal felicitation’ to Royal Challengers Bengaluru for IPL 2025 victory
content: Thousands of frenzied fans dressed in RCB jerseys waved red flags and gave a grand welcome to the new IPL champions

title: Five Kamal Haasan films that courted controversies
content: What sets the latest controversy apart is that, unlike past instances where the objections were over the film’s content or title, this time, the row has nothing to do with the movie itself.

title: Assam flood situation grim, 7 lakh affected
content: The current wave of floods has affected 1,494 villages in 66 revenue circles, the highest of 339 villages in Sribhumi, 189 in Nagaon, 166 in Cachar and 156 in Hailakandi districts.

title: Beyond tragic: Tendulkar condoles Chinnaswamy stampede deaths
content: Former cricketers AB de Villiers, Anil Kumble and Yuvraj Singh also expressed their sympathy for the victims

title: Odisha police turn Medha Patkar, activists away from Rayagada where resistance against bauxite mining simmering
content: Rayagada district has barred 24 activists from entering and participating in any protests or sit-ins in the district for two months starting June 4

title: Three women arrested for attack on Gaya doctor who treated rape survivor’s mother
content: Leader of the opposition in Bihar Legislative Assembly Tejashwi Yadav shared the video of the incident on his social media account ‘X’ saying that the situation in Bihar is worse than that under the Taliban.

title: Consecration of ‘Raja Ram’, other deities held at Ram Temple in Ayodhya
content: CM Adityanath offered prayers at the Ram Temple, had darshan of the ‘Ram Darbar’ on the first floor, and visited Hanumangarhi temple nearby

title: Those who think working in national interest is anti-party activity need to question themselves: Shashi Tharoor
content: “We didn't need persuading by anybody, because our signal from day one was, if Pakistan hits back, we will hit them even harder. If they stop, we will stop. We said that from the first day. We said it on the last day,” says Shashi Tharoor

title: Meghalaya murder: 'I was killed', say posters at honeymooner's funeral; kin fear wife abducted
content: Raja Raghuvanshi was discovered murdered in Meghalaya, and his wife, Sonam, is still missing, prompting allegations of a botched investigation. The family is demanding a CBI probe and Army assistance, claiming local police are not taking the case seriously.

title: FIR filed against RCB, event organisers over Bengaluru stampede
content: Bengaluru Police have filed an FIR against the RCB franchise, DNA Entertainment Networks, and the KSCA Administrative Committee following the tragic stampede on Wednesday that resulted in 11 fatalities. The FIR, registered at Cubbon Park Police Station, cites criminal negligence.

title: Drones, K9 units: Post-Pahalgam attack, a full-spectrum shield for Amarnath Yatra
content: Ahead of the Amarnath Yatra, the government is implementing heightened security measures, deploying 581 CAPF companies, jammers, drones, and K9 units. Scheduled from July 3 to August 9, the pilgrimage will see signal jammers used for convoy protection against IED threats. Security forces will be stationed along the Pahalgam and Baltal routes, utilizing ROPs, QATs, BDS, and advanced surveillance technologies.

title: AI killing jobs: Google AI CEO Hassabis has a tip; If I were a student..
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: 'Madam N': How Pakistani woman lured Indian influencers to turn spies
content: Noshaba Shehzad, a Pakistani businesswoman, is accused of running an ISI-backed spy ring in India, using her travel agency to recruit influencers and facilitate covert operations. She allegedly exploited religious pilgrimages and manipulated visa processes with the help of Pakistani officials to funnel funds and operatives into India.

title: Shocking! Chahal played IPL with 3 fractures, RJ Mahvash reveals
content: Amidst dating rumors, RJ Mahvash lauded Yuzvendra Chahal's unwavering dedication during IPL 2025. Despite suffering three fractures, including fractured ribs and a bowling finger, the leg-spinner played the entire season for Punjab Kings. Mahvash highlighted Chahal's warrior spirit and the team's resilience, even in their narrow final defeat against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

title: Watch: After Ayodhya visit, Elon Musk’s father offers prayers at ISKCON Temple
content: Errol Musk, father of Elon Musk, visited the ISKCON Temple in New Delhi, engaging in rituals and prayers amidst chants. This spiritual visit followed his trip to Ayodhya, where he praised the Ram temple and the kindness of the Indian people. Musk is in India to explore green technology with Servotech, balancing business with cultural immersion.

title: Tech layoffs: Google, Microsoft, Intel and other companies that cut jobs in 2025
content: The tech industry continues to face significant job cuts in 2025, with over 62,000 employees laid off in the first five months. Major companies like Microsoft, Google, and Intel are implementing layoffs due to economic uncertainty and restructuring efforts. Companies are prioritizing profitability and streamlining operations, leading to workforce reductions across various divisions and management levels.

title: Big boost for Make In India: Dassault ties up with Tata to build Rafale parts
content: Tata Advanced Systems will manufacture Rafale fighter aircraft fuselages in India, marking the first production of these components outside France. This collaboration with Dassault Aviation involves establishing an advanced manufacturing facility in Hyderabad.

title: 'I'm done living': Techie jumps to death from 21st floor in Pune
content: In a tragic incident in Pune's Hinjawadi area, a 25-year-old IT professional, Abhilasha Bhausaheb Kothimbhire, ended her life by jumping from the 21st floor of a building. Arriving at the Crown Green Society early morning, she visited a friend before taking the extreme step. A suicide note revealed her despair and apologies to her parents and friends for her decision.

title: ‘I didn't ask for it but ... ’: Susan reveals Modi's surprise letter; what PM wrote to chess legend
content: Chess legend Susan Polgar appreciates Prime Minister Narendra Modi's encouragement of Indian chess talent. She recalls receiving a letter from him. This recognized her work with young players. PM Modi also congratulated D Gukesh on defeating Magnus Carlsen. Gukesh later won against Arjun Erigaisi. Hikaru Nakamura then defeated Gukesh. Nakamura tied with Gukesh in third position at Norway Chess.

title: Will AI replace engineers? Sundar Pichai says: 'I expect we will...'
content: Sundar Pichai, Alphabet CEO, announced Google's plans to expand its engineering workforce through 2026, countering fears of AI-driven job losses. Pichai views AI as an accelerator, enhancing engineer productivity and enabling Google to pursue opportunities in areas like autonomous vehicles and YouTube's global expansion. This commitment signals a shift towards growth-focused investment in human capital.

title: 'Lives more important': WC-winning captain on RCB's celebrations, stampede
content: Kapil Dev expressed his sorrow over the tragic deaths of 11 fans during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations, emphasizing that lives are more valuable than celebrations and urging better safety measures for future events. He also wished the Indian team success in their upcoming Test tour of England, highlighting the importance of teamwork.

title: ‘Her laptop is still on office table’: Bengaluru techie dream ends in grief
content: Devi, a devoted RCB fan from Tamil Nadu working in Bengaluru, eagerly sought permission to attend the team's victory parade. Despite missing online ticket availability, she optimistically headed to the stadium. Tragically, her friends received a call from the hospital, marking the last communication and leaving them with the heartbreaking task of informing her parents.

title: LeBron James’ wife reveals how being a teenage mother impacted her sense of identity
content: Savannah James, wife of LeBron James, recently shared her experiences with motherhood on the podcast 'Everybody’s Crazy,' revealing how it shaped her identity. She admitted struggling to find herself outside of being a mom, especially with her sons.

title: How B'luru stampede became one of Indian cricket's worst fan disasters
content: Celebrations turned tragic in Bengaluru as a stampede at Chinnaswamy Stadium claimed 11 lives following RCB's IPL victory. Thousands gathered for a victory parade, overwhelming security near Gate 7. The Karnataka government has announced compensation for the victims' families and ordered an inquiry. Police officials had warned about the risks of holding the parade at short notice.

title: Watch: New footage of Ukraine's drone strike in Russia reveal devastation
content: Ukraine's Security Service (SBU) executed 'Operation Spider’s Web,' a covert drone strike deep inside Russia, reportedly damaging 41 warplanes across four air bases. President Zelenskyy hailed the 18-month operation as historic, claiming it hit 34% of Russia's strategic missile carriers. The SBU released video evidence of the FPV drone attacks, launched from hidden compartments in trucks near the airfields.

title: Maoist leader with Rs 40 lakh bounty killed in encounter: Report
content: Following the recent death of CPI (Maoist) leader Nambala Keshav Rao, sources report another senior Maoist, Gautam alias Sudhakar, has been killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district. Sudhakar, a central committee member with a Rs 40 lakh bounty, was reportedly gunned down during an anti-Naxalite operation in the Indravati National Park area.

title: 'Pain': RCB announce Rs 10 lakh for each family of deceased, mourn stampede tragedy
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB), the IPL 2025 champions, have pledged Rs 10 lakh each to the families of the 11 fans who tragically died in a stampede outside M. Chinnaswamy Stadium during victory celebrations. The incident occurred amidst massive crowds eager to see Virat Kohli and his teammates.

title: Greta Thunberg sails to Gaza with aid: Israel says 'we are prepared'
content: Greta Thunberg is sailing to Gaza with aid, prompting a strong response from Israel, which declared its preparedness to intercept the vessel. The Israeli military has threatened action to prevent the ship, carrying essential supplies, from reaching the war-torn enclave. This mission is part of the Freedom Flotilla Coalition's ongoing efforts to challenge the Israeli blockade and deliver humanitarian relief.

title: Harvard vs Trump : US blocks foreign students over national security concerns
content: In a controversial move, Trump has barred foreign students with Harvard-hosted visas, citing national security concerns. The order suspends new admissions and reviews existing visas, impacting over 10,000 students. Accusations include unreported disciplinary issues and ties to the Chinese government. This decision raises concerns about the future of international students in the U.S.

title: TMC MP Mahua Moitra marries former BJD MP Pinaki Misra in Germany
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has reportedly married Biju Janata Dal leader Pinaki Misra in a private ceremony in Germany. The two-time Lok Sabha member from Krishnanagar, Moitra, has not yet issued a public statement regarding the wedding. Misra is a veteran parliamentarian from Odisha’s Puri and a senior advocate of the Supreme Court.

title: B'luru stampede case: HC issues notice to govt; next hearing June 10
content: Following the deadly stampede near M Chinnaswamy Stadium during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations, the Karnataka High Court has registered a suo motu writ petition. The court acknowledged the Advocate General's status report and scheduled the next hearing for June 10.

title: IND Tour of ENG: Suryavanshi reveals plan for IPL, says 'next year, I will work on ... '
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old batting prodigy, aims to elevate his performance for Rajasthan Royals in the upcoming IPL season. Fresh off a record-breaking debut where he smashed the fastest century by an Indian off 35 balls, Suryavanshi is determined to improve further. He also earned the IPL Super Striker award.

title: 100-million-year-old dinosaur eggs recovered in Jurassic America
content: Fossil discoveries in central Utah reveal a diverse ecosystem 100 million years ago, with at least six distinct types of dinosaur eggs found. These eggshells indicate multiple oviraptorosaur species coexisted, alongside ornithopods and crocodylomorphs. Analysis of the eggs provides insights into nesting behaviors, soil conditions, and the rich microhabitats that supported this ancient environment.

title: Happy Eid-ul-Adha 2025: Eid Mubarak images, wishes, quotes & WhatsApp status
content: Eid-ul-Adha 2025 approaches, a time for Muslims worldwide to celebrate the Festival of Sacrifice. People are seeking heartfelt images, wishes, messages, and quotes to share with loved ones on social media platforms. The festival emphasizes love, compassion, and togetherness, encouraging acts of kindness and generosity in remembrance of Prophet Ibrahim's devotion.

title: Is the ‘doomsday fish’ a real omen of disaster? Here's what scientists say
content: The giant oarfish, or Regalecus glesne, is known as the 'doomsday fish'. Coastal cultures believe it signals impending disasters. Sightings are linked to earthquakes and tsunamis. The 2011 Tohoku tsunami fueled this belief. Recent oarfish videos went viral, predicting earthquakes. However, scientific research finds no connection between oarfish and seismic activity. Biological factors and climate change may explain their appearances.

title: IND vs ENG: Ponting highlights challenge for captain Gill; says 'won't be easy'
content: Ricky Ponting suggests Shubman Gill, the new Indian Test captain, should consider batting at No. 4 in the upcoming England series to ease the pressure of leadership. Ponting acknowledges Gill's strong white-ball form but notes his Test batting needs refinement.

title: Bengaluru stampede aftermath: Scene strewn with footwear, bent railings
content: A deadly stampede near Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB's IPL victory celebrations in Bengaluru resulted in 11 fatalities and 75 injuries. The tragedy occurred at Gate No. 7 amidst rumors of free tickets, exacerbated by rain and poor crowd management.

title: Who is Mahua Moitra’s husband Pinaki Misra? All about four-time MP from Puri
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has reportedly married Biju Janata Dal leader Pinaki Misra in a private ceremony in Germany. Misra, a four-time Lok Sabha MP from Puri, Odisha, is also a Senior Advocate practicing in the Supreme Court. He first entered Parliament in 1996 and has served on key committees.

title: 'Lalu's son failed Class 9 yet he wants him to be Bihar's king': Prashant Kishor
content: "We need to learn from Lalu Prasad Yadav how to worry about children. Lalu ji's son did not pass the 9th class, but Lalu Yadav is so worried about his child that he still wants him to become the king of Bihar. When we say this, people say that we complain about him. No! We are praising Lalu Yadav," Kishor said while addressing a public gathering in Bihar's Saran on Wednesday.

title: Paan Singh Tomar’s granddaughter booked for assaulting junior engineer in Jhansi
content: Sapna Tomar, granddaughter of the infamous Paan Singh Tomar, has been booked for allegedly assaulting a junior power department engineer in Jhansi. The incident occurred when a team was installing smart meters at her grandfather's house, leading to a physical altercation. A video of the confrontation has surfaced, intensifying public interest due to her family's history.

title: Covid cases in India: Coronavirus cases cross 4,500; Kerala tops chart
content: India reports 4,866 active Covid-19 cases as of June 5, 2025, with Kerala, Delhi, and West Bengal leading the count. Fatalities highlight vulnerability among those with pre-existing conditions. Globally, China, Singapore, Taiwan, and the United States report the highest cases. Citizens are advised to stay vigilant and take necessary precautions.

title: Tears of joy: Kohli's mother gets emotional after RCB’s win; pictures go viral
content: After an 18-year wait, Virat Kohli finally clinched the IPL trophy as RCB successfully defended their total. Kohli's emotional celebration, shared with Anushka Sharma and fans, highlighted the victory. His sister, Bhawna Kohli, shared heartfelt messages and family photos, celebrating the long-awaited triumph and expressing pride, while remembering their father.

title: Are banks and stock market open or closed on June 6 & 7? Check what's open for Bakrid
content: Eid al-Adha is anticipated to be celebrated in India on June 7, potentially marking a public holiday with closures for schools, colleges, and government offices. Banks will observe closures on June 6 in Thiruvananthapuram and Kochi, with varied operations on June 7 across different cities. Stock markets (NSE & BSE) will remain open, while digital banking services will continue uninterrupted.

title: No Trump worries: Why UAE is a great destination for Indian students
content: In the US today, education policy has become a weapon of ideology. Entry is no longer based on merit but on whether your passport aligns with America’s current geopolitical mood. In such a scenario, a new contender has quietly risen: the United Arab Emirates.

title: Raincoat & bloodstain: Grim clue found as search for missing bride continues
content: Meghalaya Police discovered a stained 3XL raincoat near Sohra during the search for Sonam Raghuvanshi, whose husband, Raja, was found murdered. Forensic tests are underway to determine if the stains are blood and if the raincoat matches Sonam's.

title: IPL: Sehwag reacts on Kohli winning title; says 'Tendulkar's wait was longer'
content: Virender Sehwag drew parallels between Virat Kohli's IPL trophy wait and Sachin Tendulkar's World Cup pursuit. Kohli's Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) won the IPL, with Kohli's significant contribution ending his 18-year wait. However, celebrations turned tragic as a stampede during the victory parade resulted in 11 deaths and 47 injuries, leaving Kohli and the team devastated.

title: 'RCB should be sued': India WC winner lambasts IPL franchise; B'luru stampede sparks criticism
content: Following Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory, a felicitation ceremony at Chinnaswamy Stadium turned tragic. A stampede outside the stadium resulted in 11 fatalities and several injuries, prompting strong criticism from former cricketer Madan Lal. He condemned the poor planning and crowd management, urging families of the deceased to sue RCB and the government.

title: Communal post case: Influencer Sharmistha gets bail by Calcutta HC
content: The Calcutta High Court granted interim bail to social media influencer Sharmishtha Panoli, arrested for allegedly hurting religious sentiments through an Instagram video. The court instructed the state to provide basic amenities to Panoli while in custody and restrained authorities from filing new FIRs on the same grounds.

title: 18-yr wait ends: Ponting reflects on Kohli's breakdown; says 'that’s what it means to win IPL'
content: Virat Kohli's emotional reaction after Royal Challengers Bengaluru won the IPL final shows the tournament's importance. Ricky Ponting highlights Kohli's long-awaited victory. Kohli compares the win to his love for Test cricket. He urges young players to respect the traditional format. Ponting supports Kohli's views on Test cricket. He acknowledges the significance of such moments in Kohli's career.

title: Murder inside court lockup: Inmate killed by two others; old animosity suspected
content: Aman, an inmate from Tihar jail number 8, was killed by two fellow prisoners, Jitender and Jaidev, inside the Saket court lockup on Thursday. The assault occurred after all three were brought to court for proceedings. The Delhi police reported that Jitender and Aman had a prior conflict stemming from an assault in 2024, where Aman allegedly attacked Jitender and his brother with a knife.

title: Putin strikes after warning Trump: 5 killed in Ukraine's Pryluky
content: Russian drone attacks struck Ukrainian cities. Pryluky faced an overnight attack, resulting in five deaths, including a child. Six others were wounded. Kharkiv was also hit, leaving seventeen injured, among them children and a pregnant woman. The attacks targeted residential areas. Peace talks between Ukraine and Russia occurred in Istanbul. Russia declined a ceasefire.

title: Why are there so few women coaches in professional tennis?
content: her career came to an end in 2017 at the age of 25 . she was asked if she could temporarily help as she returned to the tour . but months turned into years, and she was hailed as a professional tennis player .

title: Expert picks for Thunder-Pacers
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder and Indiana Pacers are the last two teams left standing . the Pacers won the series in five games, four of which featured 30-plus point outings from NBA MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander . this is the Thunder's second finals appearance, and it would be their first as the Oklahoma city Thunder .

title: NFL worst-to-first rankings: Which teams could skyrocket to the top of their divisions?
content: 25 teams have gone from worst to first in their division in a single season . the Texans are a recent example . there are clear indicators that help guide us as to which teams are most likely to go from best to first .

title: Don't hesitate to get Harper and Chisholm back into lineups

title: UFC 316 expert picks, best bets: How can O'Malley take back Dvalishvili's title?
content: Sean O'Malley finishes fight in round 2 vs. aljamain Sterling . he takes on titleholder merab Dvalishvili in main event of 316 on saturday (10 p.m. ET on ESPN PPV) he held title from august 2023 to September 2024 when he lost by unanimous decision .
